availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Joy, Wayne County, New York, soldier. New York native. Son of Gaius and Catherine Taylor Granger. Graduate of the United States Military Academy in 1845. Brevetted major on September 2, 1861. Promoted to brigadier general on March 26, 1862. Promoted to major general on September 17, 1862, and took command of the Army of Kentucky. Commander of the IV Corps in the Army of the Cumberland from 1863-1864.

ab.bibl:
George W. Cullum, Biographical Register of the Officers And Graduates of the U.S. Military Academy At West Point, N.Y.: From Its Establishment, In 1802, to 1890, With the Early History of the United States Military Academy, 3rd ed. (Boston: Houghton, Mifflin, 1891). entry #1265.
Find A Grave, "Gordon Granger (1821-1876)," Memorial #5894120, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5894120 (accessed January 7, 2019).
